title: Indianapolis man dies days after being shot by uncle
content:
Homicide investigators with the Indianapolis Metropolitan Police Department have taken over the investigation into a weekend shooting that left an 18-year-old Indianapolis man dead.
IMPD officers were dispatched to a residence in the 6600 block of Little Leaf Place just after 2 a.m. Saturday on calls of a person shot. There, they found 18-year-old Kodi Pruner with a gunshot wound to the head.
He was taken to Eskenazi Hospital in critical condition, where he was later pronounced brain dead.
According to court documents, 49-year-old William Zweck was intoxicated as he approached his nephew, Kodi Pruner, with a .22-caliber revolver and pointed it at him. When Pruner moved to push the gun away, the gun went off, firing a bullet through Pruner's right eye and into his brain.
Witnesses showed officers to Zweck's nearby home, where they found him sitting in a chair in his driveway, according to court documents. Before officers could ask him questions, Zweck told police it was an accident and that he didn't mean to shoot Pruner.
While being taken in for questioning, Zweck again told officers he didn't mean to hurt Pruner.
"I should have come outside with the gun in my hands, so you guys would have shot me," he told police.
He continued: "My sister will never forgive me."
Pruner died Tuesday morning after life support was ended, according to court documents.
Zweck was charged Tuesday with reckless homicide, pointing a firearm and carrying a handgun without a license.
